message.content: This question requires some knowledge about equine behavior and the role of weather conditions. Horses can start trembling or shivering when a cold front is moving in. Cold weather can affect a horse's body temperature and prompt a shivering response as a way to generate heat and maintain body temperature. Option (A) is incorrect because it is a subjective and unrelated scenario. Option (C) is also incorrect because getting a movie role does not directly cause a physical response like trembling. Option (D) is unrelated because the sun coming out does not typically cause trembling in horses.

This question requires basic knowledge about horse behavior and environmental factors that can affect them. Horses are known to be sensitive to changes in weather, such as the approach of a cold front. When a cold front is moving in, the barometric pressure drops, which can cause horses to feel anxious and start trembling. Option (A) is incorrect because horses trembling due to fear of competition is not a typical behavior. Option (C) is unlikely to cause a horse to tremble unless it is an exceptionally sensitive horse. Option (D) is incorrect because the sun coming out would not typically cause a horse to tremble.
